bio:treatment.discussion: Subspecies arvense is probably more widespread in North America than present information suggests, but identification of herbarium specimens can be difficult and uncertain. However, in the field the two subspecies are readily distinguishable because of the larger size of subsp. arvense and its strongly rhizomatous habit. Hybrids with C. tomentosum (which have been called C. Ã—maureri Schulze, an invalid name) are readily formed when the two taxa grow together (J. K. Morton 1973).
